meanings: [동사] admit, approve (of), allow[let, permit] (sb/sth to do), (formal) countenance, (억지로) tolerate

examples.korean: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 이런 종류의 행위는 용인되지 않을 것이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: She had no tolerance for jokes of any kind. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그녀는 어떤 종류의 농담도 용인하지 않았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She had no tolerance for jokes of any kind. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: She refused to tolerate being called a liar. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그녀는 거짓말쟁이라고 불리는 것을 용인하지 않으려고 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She refused to tolerate being called a liar. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Children must learn socially acceptable behaviour. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 아이들은 사회적으로 용인되는 행동을 배워야만 한다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Children must learn socially acceptable behaviour. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Their relationship was tolerated but not encouraged. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그들의 관계는 용인은 되었지만 격려를 받지는 못했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Their relationship was tolerated but not encouraged. Add to Wordbook
